page.title: 05Bideford:S+SE.Development.
page.content: Both of the local Planning Authorities (Torridge and Torrington),are committed to conservation,but some of their plans ,as those of higher bodies,may have unfavourable consequences for this area.Increased recreational use of the Torridge,such as the approved policies of building a marina and providing in- creased mooring facilities lower down the river,bodes ill for the future.Even if boats are excluded from the more sensitive parts of the estuary,their effluent will still have a deleterious effect there.Commercial fishermen were already encountering difficulties from water-skiing and power-boats, in 1979. A 5 acre tourist development at Ford House,in the midst of woodland regarded as of special importance,poses another threat.New roads west and east of the area may bring more development,and even Jennett's is threatened obliquely.
